feed.title: Google Cloud: Vertex AI
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: Vertex AI

entry.content:
M134 release

The M134 release of Vertex AI Workbench instances includes the following:

  • Patched a regression with custom notebook metrics reporting (for example, jupyterlab_kernels and docker_status metrics).
  • Updated the Dataproc JupyterLab plugin (dataproc-jupyter-plugin) to version 0.1.92.
  • When using Google Cloud CLI commands, the project and region properties are preset.
entry.summary: The M134 release of Vertex AI Workbench includes fixes for custom metrics reporting and an update to the Dataproc JupyterLab plugin. Google Cloud CLI commands now have preset project and region properties.
entry.title: Feature: M134 release

entry.content: Generally available (GA): You can use Workforce Identity Federation with Vertex AI Workbench instances. Workforce Identity Federation lets you create and manage Vertex AI Workbench instances with credentials provided by an external identity provider (IdP). For more information, see Create an instance with third party credentials.
entry.summary: You can now use Workforce Identity Federation with Vertex AI Workbench instances. This feature allows you to manage Vertex AI Workbench instances using credentials from an external identity provider.
entry.title: Feature: Workforce Identity Federation for Vertex AI Workbench

entry.content: DeepSeek-V3.2-Exp is available through Model Garden.
entry.summary: The DeepSeek-V3.2-Exp model is now accessible via Model Garden.
entry.title: Feature: DeepSeek-V3.2-Exp Now Available

entry.content: DeepSeek-V3.1-Terminus is available through Model Garden.
entry.summary: The DeepSeek-V3.1-Terminus model is now accessible via Model Garden, offering new capabilities for users.
entry.title: Feature: DeepSeek-V3.1-Terminus Now on Model Garden

entry.content:
M133 release

The M133 release of Vertex AI Workbench instances includes the following:

  • Patched an incompatibility with the Dataproc JupyterLab plugin (dataproc-jupyter-plugin) and instances with end-user credentials enabled.
entry.summary: The M133 release of Vertex AI Workbench instances addresses an incompatibility with the Dataproc JupyterLab plugin for instances with end-user credentials enabled.
entry.title: Feature: M133 Vertex AI Workbench Release

entry.content:
Vector Search indexes optimized for storage (Preview)

Storage-optimized Vector Search offers a cost-effective solution for searching massive datasets. This new tier is ideal for large-scale RAG and semantic search applications, and simplifies development with a new auto-tuning feature that eliminates the need to manage the underlying index configuration. This feature is available in Preview.

For more information, see Storage-optimized Vector Search.
entry.summary: Introducing a cost-effective solution for massive datasets. Ideal for large-scale RAG and semantic search, it simplifies development with auto-tuning. Available in Preview.
entry.title: Feature: Storage-optimized Vector Search

entry.content:
Vertex AI Agent Engine

Agent Engine now supports the following features:

  • Agent Engine Code Execution, now in Preview, lets your agent run code in an isolated sandbox environment. For more information, see Code Execution.
  • You can now develop, deploy, and use agents that support the Agent-to-Agent (A2A) protocol on Agent Engine. For more information, see Develop an Agent2Agent agent.
  • Agent Engine now supports bidirectional streaming. For more information, see Bidirectional streaming.
  • The Vertex AI Agent Engine page in the Google Cloud console has a Memory Bank tab for displaying and managing memories.
entry.summary: Vertex AI Agent Engine has released several new features, including Code Execution (in Preview), support for the Agent-to-Agent (A2A) protocol, bidirectional streaming, and a Memory Bank tab in the Google Cloud console for managing memories.
entry.title: Feature: New Features for Vertex AI Agent Engine

entry.content:
Vertex AI Agent Engine

In version v1.112.0 of the Vertex AI SDK for Python, the agent_engines module has been refactored to a client-based design. For information about updating your existing code to the new design, see the Migration guide.
entry.summary: The Vertex AI SDK for Python has refactored its agent_engines module to a client-based design in version v1.112.0. Refer to the migration guide for instructions on updating your code.
entry.title: Breaking: Vertex AI Agent Engine Update

entry.content: EmbeddingGemma and DeepSeek-V3.1 models are available through Model Garden.
entry.summary: EmbeddingGemma and DeepSeek-V3.1 models are now accessible via Model Garden.
entry.title: Feature: New Models Available on Model Garden

entry.content: AI Singapore's SEA-LION V4 models are available through Model Garden. They are open models for Southeast Asian languages, built by leveraging Vertex AI Model Development Service for enhanced training efficiency and model accuracy.
entry.summary: AI Singapore's SEA-LION V4 models, offering open access to Southeast Asian language capabilities, are now available on Model Garden. These models were developed using Vertex AI Model Development Service to improve training efficiency and accuracy.
entry.title: Feature: SEA-LION V4 models now in Model Garden

entry.content:
Vertex AI Agent Engine

Agent Engine now supports the following enterprise security features:

  • You can now deploy your agents in a private VPC environment, configuring a Private Service Connect interface, to ensure data privacy and meet security and compliance requirements. For more information, see Configure Private Service Connect interface.
  • You can now use your own customer-managed encryption keys (CMEK) to protect data at rest.
  • You can now specify customized resource controls, such as the minimum and maximum number of application instances, resource limits for each container, and concurrency for each container.
  • As a part of Vertex AI Platform, Vertex AI Agent Engine now supports HIPAA workloads.

For more information, see Agent Engine overview.
entry.summary: Secure your AI agents with new enterprise features, including private VPC deployment, customer-managed encryption keys, customized resource controls, and HIPAA compliance.
entry.title: Feature: New Security Features for Vertex AI Agent Engine

entry.content: Gemma 3 270M, Wan 2.2 and Wan 2.1 models are available through Model Garden.
entry.summary: New models available!
entry.title: Feature: Gemma 3 270M, Wan 2.2, and Wan 2.1

entry.content: OpenAI's gpt-oss-120b and gpt-oss-20b are available as Model as a Service (MaaS) models in Model Garden.
entry.summary: OpenAI models now available on Google Cloud
entry.title: Feature: New OpenAI models

entry.content: Qwen3 Coder and Qwen3 235B are available as Model as a Service (MaaS) models in Model Garden.
entry.summary: New Qwen3 models available on Vertex AI.
entry.title: Feature: Qwen3 Models Now on MaaS

entry.content: OpenAI's gpt-oss models are available through Model Garden.
entry.summary: OpenAI's gpt-oss models are now available on Model Garden.
entry.title: Feature: OpenAI Models on Model Garden

entry.content: Added Gemma 3 fine-tuning notebook using Axolotl docker with support for 1b, 4b, 12b, and 27b variants.
entry.summary: We have added a new notebook that allows you to fine-tune Gemma 3 models using Axolotl. This notebook supports all Gemma 3 variants, including 1b, 4b, 12b, and 27b.
entry.title: Feature: Gemma 3 Fine-Tuning Notebook Added

entry.content: Multimodal MedGemma 27B IT, MedSigLIP, and T5Gemma models are available through Model Garden.
entry.summary: New models are available in Model Garden, including multimodal MedGemma 27B IT, MedSigLIP, and T5Gemma.
entry.title: Feature: New models available in Model Garden

entry.content:
To reduce the cost of running your inference jobs, you can now use flex-start VMs, which are powered by Dynamic Workload Scheduler. Flex-start VMs offer significant discounts and are well-suited for short-duration workloads. This feature is available in Preview.

For more information, see Use DWS flex-start VMs with inference.
entry.summary: You can now use flex-start VMs for your inference jobs to reduce costs. These VMs are powered by Dynamic Workload Scheduler and offer significant discounts, making them ideal for short-duration workloads. This feature is currently in Preview.
entry.title: Feature: New VM option for cheaper inference jobs

entry.content: The global endpoint is generally available (GA) for Anthropic's Claude Opus 4. For details, see Global endpoint.
entry.summary: Anthropic's Claude Opus 4 is now generally available through the global endpoint. This feature allows users to access the model from any region.
entry.title: Feature: Claude Opus 4 Now Available Globally

entry.content: Mistral Nemo, which is offered as a Model as a Service (MaaS) model in Model Garden, is deprecated. For details, see Model as a Service (MaaS) deprecations.
entry.summary: Mistral Nemo, a Model as a Service (MaaS) offering in Model Garden, has been deprecated. For more information on MaaS deprecations, please refer to the official documentation.
entry.title: Deprecated: Mistral Nemo MaaS Deprecation

entry.content: Anthropic's Claude 3 Opus, which is offered as a Model as a Service (MaaS) model in Model Garden, is deprecated. For details, see Model as a Service (MaaS) deprecations.
entry.summary: Anthropic's Claude 3 Opus model offered in Model Garden is now deprecated. For more information, please refer to the Model as a Service (MaaS) deprecations documentation.
entry.title: Deprecated: Claude 3 Opus Deprecation

entry.content: Vertex AI online inference now offers Preview support of PSC service automation that can automatically create PSC endpoints for dedicated private endpoints. For more information, see Create the online inference endpoint with PSC automation.
entry.summary: Vertex AI online inference now supports PSC service automation, which can automatically create PSC endpoints for dedicated private endpoints. This simplifies the process of setting up private endpoints for your online inference needs.
entry.title: Feature: Vertex AI online inference adds PSC service automation

entry.content: Vertex AI now offers GA support of Private Service Connect Interface and includes Private DNS Peering. For more information, see Use Private Service Connect interface for Vertex AI Training.
entry.summary: Vertex AI now provides general availability support for Private Service Connect interface, which includes Private DNS peering. This enhancement allows for more secure and private connections to Vertex AI services.
entry.title: Feature: Vertex AI Enhances Connectivity with Private Service Connect

entry.content:
Private Service Connect interface (PSC-I) support for ML pipeline runs in Vertex AI Pipelines is now generally available. PSC-I is recommended for private connectivity because it reduces the chance of IP exhaustion, allows for transitive peering, and includes Private DNS Peering.

For more information, see Configure Private Service Connect interface for a pipeline.
entry.summary: Private Service Connect interface (PSC-I) support for ML pipeline runs in Vertex AI Pipelines.
entry.title: Feature: Feature Announcement: PSC-I Support for Vertex AI Pipelines

entry.content: Gemma 3n models are now available through Model Garden.
entry.summary: Gemma 3n models are now accessible via Model Garden, offering advanced capabilities for various applications.
entry.title: Feature: Gemma 3n models now in Model Garden

entry.content: The Generative AI module in the Vertex AI SDK is deprecated. For information about migrating to the Google Gen AI SDK, see the migration guide.
entry.summary: The Generative AI module in the Vertex AI SDK has been deprecated. For migration details, please refer to the official migration guide.
entry.title: Deprecated: Vertex AI SDK Generative AI module deprecated

entry.content:
Vector Search custom constraints with Organization Policy

You can use custom constraints with the Organization Policy Service to provide more granular control over specific fields for indexes and index endpoints in Vector Search.

For more information, see Create custom constraints for Vector Search.
entry.summary: You can now use custom constraints with the Organization Policy Service to gain finer control over specific fields for indexes and index endpoints in Vector Search.
entry.title: Feature: Vector Search custom constraints
